I approached one group, curious about these strange beings. They greeted me warmly, welcoming me to their little community.
“Welcome to heaven,” they said, with a hint of wonder in their voices. “We’re so glad you’re here.”
I was stunned. How did I get here? What good deeds had I done to deserve such an amazing reward? But before I could ask, a figure appeared before me, cloaked in shadow.
“Ah, another soul,” he said, his voice low and menacing. “What brings you to our humble abode?”
I turned to face him, my heart racing. He was tall and imposing, with piercing eyes that seemed to bore into my very soul. His presence filled me with unease, but I steeled myself, determined to uncover the truth.
“I don’t know how I got here,” I admitted, feeling a lump form in my throat. “What happened to me?”
The demon chuckled, a cold, mirthless sound. “This is hell, dear soul,” he said, his eyes glinting with malice. “And you are most definitely not in heaven.”
My mind raced, trying to process the demon’s words. Hell? But I had lived a good life, helped others whenever I could. Hadn’t I done enough good deeds to merit a place in the afterlife?
But the demon just laughed again, his eyes gleaming with amusement. “You have much to learn, little soul,” he said, before disappearing into the shadows, leaving me alone once more.
I sighed, feeling lost and confused. How could this be hell when it felt so much like paradise? And why would the demon lie to me? Was I trapped in some kind of cruel joke?
I wandered the gardens, searching for answers, but found none. Perhaps I was meant to find my way back home, or maybe I was stuck here forever, lost in this strange, beautiful limbo.
